alert.note: Alert for Fairfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 03 at 8:42PM EST until further notice by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Carolina... Wateree River At Lake Wateree affecting Fairfield, Kershaw and Lancaster Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wateree River at Lake Wateree. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 100.4 feet, The piers on the Wildlife Road bridge over Singleton Creek become submerged. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM EST Wednesday the stage was 100.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 100.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 PM EST Wednesday was 101.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady above flood stage at 100.9 feet. - Flood stage is 100.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday morning at 1045 AM EST.
